--- title: Simulation Toolkit For Scientific Discovery (ST4SD) --- import { CodeSyntax } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { NetworkServices } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { CarbonForIbmDotcom } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Kubernetes } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; The Simulation Toolkit for Scientific Discovery (ST4SD) simplifies the development, execution and dissemination of **virtual experiments**.
A **virtual experiment** is an application workflow which measures one or more characteristics of one or more input systems. It is the computational analog of a lab experiment.
}> **ST4SD Core** enables writing virtual experiments that can run on your laptop, on HPC machines, or on cloud. [Get Started](/st4sd-core-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Cloud** creates and maintains secure, scalable and robust deployments of ST4SD on OpenShift clusters. [Get Started](/st4sd-cloud-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Registry** provides a UI for sharing and browsing virtual experiments. [Get Started](/st4sd-registry-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Services** allows scientists to run virtual experiments and query their data via Jupyter notebooks. It includes a high-performance metadata-store that enables memoization. [Get Started](/st4sd-services-getting-started)
## Try it yourself `pip install "st4sd-runtime-core[develop]"`, which installs the command-line-tool `elaunch.py`, and execute the following code to run a toy-experiment:
python 3.7 to 3.10 tested
```bash git clone https://github.com/st4sd/sum-numbers.git elaunch.py --nostamp -l40 sum-numbers ``` This clones a repository into a directory called `sum-numbers` in your current working dir. It then uses the `elaunch.py` tool to run the toy experiment defined in `sum-numbers` directory. The output of the `elaunch.py` command will be a directory called `sum-numbers.instance` in the same directory you ran `elaunch.py`. To learn more visit [ST4SD Core](/st4sd-core-getting-started) and try an example of running a real chemistry experiment. Then check the [ST4SD Core tutorial](/tutorial) which uses the `sum-numbers` workflow to illustrate key features.
